Dialogue: That's AQI's racket now. Your Sheik got edged out. This could be blowback.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Or he could be upset The Butcher cut off his wife's hand. Either way, seems like you'd wanna explore it.

Speaker: agent shead
Dialogue: This is your guy here.  We believe The Butcher is Zarqawi's number two man.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: But you don't know his real name or you'd have it written up there.

Speaker: agent shead
Dialogue: We have several aliases--  If "Fanus" is legit we go see the Sheik.

Speaker: agent shead
Dialogue: If he delivers the Butcher he'll get it.  This is Agent Shead, DIA, I need a name check on "Amir Khalaf Fanus." I'll wait.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: If we're going back out, TEAM 3 could pull security--

Speaker: agent shead
Dialogue: If we're humping money the head-shed will want contractors on it.  I'm here. What do you got?

Speaker: contractor
Dialogue: Road-kill.

Speaker: agent shead
Dialogue: The Butcher is Zarqawi's enforcer. They say his weapon of choice is a drill.

Dialogue: I went to seminary school before I joined the Navy. Came close to being a preacher.

Dialogue: Why didn't you?

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: I love to gamble, man. Love those dice.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: My kind of preacher.

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: It's like that now, huh?

Speaker: chris kyle
Dialogue: You haven't heard? I'm The Legend.  Hey babe--

Speaker: chris kyle
Dialogue: It's a boy!

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: Hell yeah. Congratu--

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Chris!--

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: I heard one shot.

Speaker: chris kyle
Dialogue: Check. Large caliber. Came in at an angle, gotta be 300 or more out--

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: He's all over us. You get a bead?

Speaker: chris kyle
Dialogue: Negative--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Minaret, 11 o'clock!

Speaker: agent shead
Dialogue: There's no room. We'll come back for you--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You got eyes on that?

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: Negative.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Eyes on The Butcher. He's got that Sheikh's kid in the street--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Fuck!--

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: --requesting back-up. We're pinned down taking sniper fire on approach of high-

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: We're on the wrong end of this.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm gonna pop smoke for cover but don't move till I say.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Hold.

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: We gotta go--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Holding! Hold...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Move now. Go--

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: How you know he'd wait--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Cause I'd wait.  In the smoky haze, A SAT PHONE in the dirt--

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Chris--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Go around. I'll go high.

Speaker: the butcher
Dialogue: You talk to them, you die with them.

Speaker: chris kyle
Dialogue: He had line-of-sight 500 meters out.

Speaker: biggles
Dialogue: Colonel Gronski is all over Marc, bro.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: We need to work up a squad to pursue him.

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: They're shutting us down.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: We're confined to base pending an incident review.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Can he do that? Just shelf us like that? I ship home in three weeks.

Speaker: biggles
Dialogue: It's gonna be a long three weeks.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: I thought you were dead. I thought--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Shh. I'm know. I'm so sorry.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You're the most beautiful thing I've ever seen.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: I have an alien growing inside me--

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: And there's a strange man in my bedroom.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Our bedroom.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Why isn't it on your finger?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: If it catches the light...

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Your hands feel different.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: They're mine. I swear...

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Why am I so fucking nervous?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm nervous too.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: No you're not. Don't lie.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I am... What if that little alien reaches out and grabs me?

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Why are you so good with me.  Her face opens in ecstasy.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Huh?--

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: What do you want to do today, hon'?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Maybe we just relax here?

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Okay, we do that. Let's relax.

Speaker: doctor hoffstader
Dialogue: How you feeling?

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: I'm done being pregnant. I want to meet him.

Speaker: doctor hoffstader
Dialogue: It'll be any day now.

Speaker: doctor hoffstader
Dialogue: How about you Mr. Kyle? How're you feeling?

Speaker: chris kyle
Dialogue: Good. Doing good.

Speaker: doctor hoffstader
Dialogue: I imagine you're still decompressing.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Not really.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Well, this is the first time we left the house.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm just happy to be home.

Speaker: doctor hoffstader
Dialogue: Here, slip this on for me.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: If you wanna help, you should be looking at my knees. I don't know what I did but--

Dialogue: Are you a smoker?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: No, ma'am.

Speaker: doctor hoffstader
Dialogue: Do you drink?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Only when I'm thirsty.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Jesus Christ Chris...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Is that high?

Speaker: doctor hoffstader
Dialogue: Not if you just had 14 cups of coffee. But for someone who is sitting down--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'll look into it. Thanks doc.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You sabotaged me back there.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: What am I supposed to do. You're not talking. You act like it's all okay--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: It is okay. I'm fine.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: You're not fine. Your blood pressure--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Babe, I'm driving down the freeway, it's sunny and 72 degrees. I'm fine. But there are people dying over there and I look around and it's like it's not even happening. It's barely on the news, no one talks about it. No one cares. And if I stay too long I'll forget about it too.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Chris--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: We're at war and I'm headed to the mall.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I don't belong here. I can't help anybody-

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: --it's happening--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Oh shit--

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: What're you doing!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm going back.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: --oh my god, you're crazy! You're fucking crazy you know that?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: My little man...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Look at our boy. Look what we did.  I love you, baby. We made it--

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Don't bother turning it off, I already watched it.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: I had to make sure you didn't have an Iraqi girlfriend sending sexy videos.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: This sniper is recording his kills. Mustafa. They sell these in the street.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: That day we were on the phone--

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: You're not protecting me by not talking about it.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I don't want you thinking about it. I don't need you worrying.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: My imagination is so much worse than anything you could tell me--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: No, it's not. They're savages.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Chris--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: They're fuckin savages.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: It's not about them, it's about us.  You have to make it back to us.  Her eyes trail off him as she steps into the kitchen.  Chris holds his son, taken with his ruddy innocence. Then the BEDOUIN MUSIC swells, his arms tighten around his son, and his eyes are drawn back to Mustafa.  "SECOND TOUR"

Dialogue: Slower than Christmas.

Dialogue: Fuck this place.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You guys know how I hate this shit so shut your traps. Our target is Amir Khalaf Fanus aka The Butcher.  We'll be heading in under cover of darkness, sector P13, north of the river--

Speaker: biggles
Dialogue: You give good power-point, Legend.

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: Is this thing bulletproof?  You never open it so I assumed...

Speaker: chris kyle
Dialogue: God, country, family, right?

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: You got a God?

Speaker: chris kyle
Dialogue: You getting weird on me?

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: We had this electric fence around our property in Oregon and us kids used to see who could grab it and hang on the longest. War feels like that, it puts lightning in your bones, makes it hard to hold on to anything else.

Speaker: chris kyle
Dialogue: You need to sit this one out?

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: I just wanna believe in what we're doing--

Speaker: chris kyle
Dialogue: Evil lives here, we've seen it.

Speaker: marc lee
Dialogue: It lives everywhere--

Speaker: chris kyle
Dialogue: You want to invite these motherfuckers to come fight in San Diego? Or New York? We're protecting more than this dirt.

Dialogue: Big freezers.

Dialogue: Let's keep eyes on it get pictures of anyone coming and going.

Dialogue: Fucking Chief Nappy-nap.  A challenging smile. Chris flips him off.  "D" Got some nice rugs up in here.  This shit is hand-knotted. Beautiful.  Surveillance rolling, Chris closes his eyes.

Dialogue: Negative. Nothing yet.

Dialogue: Tell him this boy's father was fighting for the people that butchered the clerics we found in the freezer in there.

Dialogue: - This is our territory. If you want to come here, you ask me. If you want to find someone, I find them-

Dialogue: -I am the seventh son of Isaac of Abraham. This is the land of my father, and I am not afraid.- He says your evil is greater than those you fight. He calls you white satan, devil of Ramadi.

Dialogue: You tell him to deliver The Butcher to us, or the devil comes back.

Dialogue: You don't get to choose, bubba.

Dialogue: But I don't like it! I want that one--

Dialogue: You get what it gives you. That's how this thing works.

Dialogue: Don't do this. Get up. Come on--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Get off the floor. Right now--

Dialogue: Are you... "Chief" Chris Kyle?

Dialogue: That's me.

Dialogue: Sorry to intrude, sir, but we met in Fallujah. You saved my life.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Did I--?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah. Right. Well, you Marines saved our ass plenty out there. How you holding up?

Dialogue: It cost lots of guys more than a leg.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Did you lose some friends?

Speaker: mads
Dialogue: That too, but I'm talking about guys that lived. They made it back but they're just not back. They can't seem to get right.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah, I-- I'm sorry to hear that.

Speaker: mads
Dialogue: You should come down to the VA sometime. The guys would love it. They all know who The Legend is.

Speaker: mads
Dialogue: I bet you missed your daddy when he was gone. But can I tell you something? Your dad is a hero. He saved my life--  He helped me get home to my little girl.

Speaker: mads
Dialogue: So thank you for loaning him to us, li'l man. I wouldn't be here without him.

Speaker: mads
Dialogue: My family thanks you for your service.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: I'm making memories by myself. I have no one to share them with.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: We have the rest of our lives for that.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: When does that start? Even when you're here you're not here.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: I hate the teams for it. I do. You're my husband and the father of my children-- but they're the ones that pull you back.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: We can wait. They can't.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: You can only circle the flame so long.

Dialogue: --we are tailing the Butcher's courier, turning onto Maryland Street. Over.

Dialogue: I bought the ring.

Dialogue: Here?

Dialogue: They're cheaper here.

Dialogue: Not for a rock.

Dialogue: Whatever, man.

Dialogue: Ease off, don't get too close.  You gonna tell her where it came from?

Dialogue: That should do it.

Dialogue: We're headed to the roof. Secure the van.

Dialogue: He didn't--

Dialogue: She's not like that.

Dialogue: No!--

Dialogue: No, buddy. No! Stay with me--

Dialogue: --I'm sorry--

Dialogue: We'll rub a little dirt in it, get you a sip of water, you'll be fine.

Dialogue: We're going back.

Dialogue: Marc--

Dialogue: Marc wrote that letter two weeks ago. Did he say any of that to you?

Dialogue: Chris? I want to know what you thought of his letter...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: An AQI informant called in a tip. Biggles had just been shot. We were operating off emotion and-- we walked into an ambush.

Dialogue: But that's not what killed him. That letter did. That letter killed Marc.  He let go and he paid the price for it.

Dialogue: If something ever happened to me-- you'd meet someone else. You'd be alright.

Dialogue: Do you want to die? Is that what it is?

Dialogue: No.

Dialogue: Then tell me why do you do it. I want to understand.

Dialogue: I do it for you. To protect you.

Dialogue: No you don't. I'm here. Your family is here. Your children have no father--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Without this, there's nothing.

Dialogue: Bullshit. It's not about us anymore. You don't know when to quit. It's over-  You did your part! We sacrificed enough. Let somebody else go--

Dialogue: I could never live with myself.

Dialogue: You find a way! You have to. I need you to be human again. I need you here.  If you leave again, we might not be here when you get back.

Dialogue: I know.  Her eyes sink into a well of ruin.

Dialogue: Hey, buddy--

Dialogue: Chris? Where are you?

Dialogue: I'm right here just give me a minute--  Just blind as a bat, huh?

Dialogue: That's good. Your face always needed a little fixing.

Dialogue: I heard you proposed? Did you tell Kelly the diamond was from Zales?

Dialogue: Naw, I bought a new one. A small one. Her dad helped me out.

Dialogue: Nice.

Dialogue: She wouldn't leave me, bro. I told her to go-- but she wouldn't leave.

Dialogue: No she's not. How can you say that? She's getting you.  All four inches.

Dialogue: I'm glad this happened to me and not you. No way you could've handled it.

Dialogue: You're probably right.

Dialogue: Is that what they say?

Dialogue: The bad guys fled up into to Sadr City.

Dialogue: We're gonna wall `em in and hunt `em down.

Dialogue: You don't have to do this.

Dialogue: Yes I do. You're my brother and they're going to pay for what they did to you.

Dialogue: Hooyah, Legend. Hooyah--

Dialogue: You have to ask the Navy. I lost count.

Dialogue: Teams and shit.

Dialogue: I know. I visited him before I left. That fucker can't see shit.

Dialogue: No--  It came from behind us. We went the wrong way. He's south of the wall.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: For Biggles.

Speaker: chris kyle
Dialogue: Tango down.

Speaker: ranger one
Dialogue: You just fucked us, Legend--  We need Stryker and QRF units, ASAP.

Speaker: chris kyle
Dialogue: He was on our boys and I took him out.

Speaker: ranger one
Dialogue: We are fucked like a football bat.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: There are two ways onto the roof. We cover both stairways and conserve ammo.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Conserve--

Speaker: ranger one
Dialogue: Negative, negative, danger-close, they're all over us--

Speaker: ranger one
Dialogue: QRF is stuck three blocks out.

Speaker: marine gunner
Dialogue: I'm out of ammo--

Speaker: ranger one
Dialogue: I don't wanna get dragged in the street--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Do it. Call in our coordinates.

Speaker: ranger one
Dialogue: I know my fucking position! They're right on top of us. Drop it!

Speaker: marine sniper
Dialogue: White-side!

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: 3-4, copy that. 30 seconds out.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: --you got four rounds.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Hey baby--

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Chris-- What's the noise?

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: I can't hear you--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm ready to come home. I'm ready...

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: What's happening--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: --I'm coming home. Can you hear me?

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Chris--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Go, go, let's move--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Stryker-3, what's your location--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Hold there! We are 30 seconds out--  Go. Straight ahead. Go--

Speaker: gunner
Dialogue: BDUs-- That's them! Drop the ramp.

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: I don't see him--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: --hello?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah, I got out early.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm here, I'm stateside.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I guess I just needed a minute.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah, I know... Me too. I'm coming.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah. I'm good.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Chris...?

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: --his game is Saturdays. He's the tallest kid on the team. The doctor said he could be six-four. I can't wait for you to see him play. Maybe you could even coach?

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: McKenna's about to lose that tooth and I'm worried she's going to swallow it. She said she'd let you pull it. But only you.

Speaker: boy's mom
Dialogue: Get him off! Get away--

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Maybe you saw things, or did some things over there that you wish you hadn't--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: That's not me.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: What's not you?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I was just protecting my guys. They were trying to kill our soldiers and-- I'm willing to stand before my creator and answer for every shot I took.  The thing that haunts me are all the guys I couldn't save.

Speaker: navy doctor
Dialogue: You want to save more guys, walk down any hall in this hospital. We got plenty soldiers that need saving.  I'm going to recommend Zoloft and--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: How's it feel?

Speaker: wynn
Dialogue: Feels like The Legend is trying to fuck up my shot. Stay still, man.

Speaker: wynn
Dialogue: Bulls-eye, boy! Damn, if that don't feel like I got my balls back.

Speaker: wynn
Dialogue: Why you spend all this time with us? I know you got a family.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I heard you had a nice boot collection before the war and--

Speaker: wynn
Dialogue: Seriously man. Why do you do it.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: We gotta take care of our own.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Get `em up, lil' lady. Hands in the air.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Can I tell you something.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Tell it to the judge.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: I'm proud of you and I don't say it enough. I feel blessed. You're an incredible father and-- I feel lucky to have my husband back.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: We could lock the doors. They can't get out of the yard.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: I know how hard you fought to get here.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You're worth fighting for.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Did you pleat those jeans?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yes, ma'am. Right up the middle.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Well, you're just a regular old cowboy again, aren't you?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I meant what I said about locking the doors.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Aren't you and Chad going to the range?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Not for four minutes.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Is that all it takes.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: It'll take half that. Then I got two minutes leftover just to look at you.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Who are you taking out?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: This Marine. His mom does parking at school and she asked for my help.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Well don't be late for dinner.

Speaker: colton
Dialogue: Dad, you want to play Skylander? Please--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I gotta go do something but when I get back, okay? But you have to let me win.

Speaker: colton
Dialogue: No way.

Speaker: mckenna
Dialogue: Poke the bear--

Speaker: mckenna
Dialogue: No. You're supposed to roar. Like Grrr.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I should get going...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Look after our women, Bubba.  Love you, babe.

Speaker: taya
Dialogue: Love you too.
